[align=center][IMG]https://i.imgur.com/g6AJTiT.png[/IMG][/align]

[color=transparent]       [/color]

[align=center][url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=3322334][img]https://i.imgur.com/rjaz79O.png[/img][/url][/align]

[b][color=white]Theme Challenge Announced![/color][/b]
"Hack Forums needs to become more mobile friendly to survive" is what [url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1][color=#9998FF][b]Omniscient[/b][/color][/url] has been saying since the MyBB upgrade. In order to achieve this, the admin has decided to issue this challenge to the designer community of Hack Forums. He would like the tab navigation to be more responsive, done by either editing the CSS or the JS. He also stated that "If this can happen everyone wins. Tabs stay and mobile users get a friendlier page." Hopefully someone takes up the call, because I'm sure most of you reading wouldn't want to see tab navigation gone for good this time.[i][size=x-small][url=https://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=5758075] >>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[b][color=white]Discord Gets the Banhammer[/color][/b]
The popular chatting application has been completely disallowed on Hack Forums in a short thread posted in the Rules, Announcements, News, and Feedback section. [url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1][color=#9998FF][b]Omniscient[/b][/color][/url] stated that he thinks the program is having too large of a negative impact on site activity to continue to allow it as the reason for this policy change.[i][size=x-small][url=https://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=5756944] >>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[b][color=white]Possibility of Hack Forums Credits?[/color][/b]
[url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1][color=#9998FF][b]Omniscient[/b][/color][/url] created a short thread proposing the idea of implementing a Hack Forums credits system. These credits could possibly be used for on-site transactions such as upgrading or purchasing stickies. [url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1][color=#9998FF][b]Omniscient[/b][/color][/url] stated that the system would be mostly used to combat the ever-rising Bitcoin transaction fees, allowing members to perform many less transactions and hold the credits until they are ready to use them.[i][size=x-small][url=https://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=5759147] >>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[color=transparent]       [/color]

[color=transparent]       [/color]

[align=center][img]http://hackforums.news/assets/v3/Memo.png[/img][/align]

[b][color=white]Recruitment[/color][/b]
If you are interested in joining a team of journalists to help write sections for the community, we are now recruiting. We're looking for members who are motivated and enjoy doing the work. If you think you're one of those, then what are you waiting for? Head on over to our [url=https://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=5158658]recruitment thread[/url] to fill out your application. Best of luck!

[b][color=white]Suggestions & Feedback[/color][/b]
We're listening. If you have any ideas or feedback, send em our way. We'll consider everything and go from there. Lots of room for improvement on our end and we're committed to fill that up.

[b][color=white]Net Neutrality Repeal[/color][/b]
Net neutrality prevents the internet from turning into cable TV. Cable TV in the U.S. currently has you pay extra for certain packages you may be in need of. It also protects the internet from ISPs enforcing "fast lanes" which will either throttle all users unless they pay extra [i]or[/i] those who pay will have a faster connect lane to media on the internet. [sp=Portugal is a prime example for what can happen if we lose net neutrality.][img]http://beta.latimes.com/resizer/PjGn8fYi6rT4Bq-1WdkiLqcZ6kk=/1400x0/arc-anglerfish-arc2-prod-tronc.s3.amazonaws.com/public/Z6KXLRVMDNARVM3M3OBIKV64TE.jpg/img][/sp]
There's a lot more to it but these few are the major points for why we must stand up against FCC. We must make noise. We must email. We must call.

https://www.battleforthenet.com/

FCC votes Dec 14. and they will vote to repeal. 3 of the 5 members in the panel are all for the repeal, the other 2 are not. Reddit is currently making a lot of noise and you can help and join the cause: https://www.reddit.com/r/blog/comments/7fx1x4/an_update_on_the_fight_for_the_free_and_open/

[color=transparent]   [/color]

[align=center][url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=561239][img]https://i.imgur.com/IUjI3rb.png[/img][/url][/align]

[b][color=white]Summer Will Become Hotter Than Every Previous Year[/color][/b]
Based off a study published over a month ago, summer will be getting hotter every other year and will only get worse. The study states that by 2030, summer temperatures will be hotter every other year. By 2050, summer will be hotter every single year with a 95% chance. However, this study only applies to the northern hemisphere. We are now 70 times more likely to hit record hot summers than 40 years ago. Personally, this is bad. Really bad. A study done by the same author found that 30% of the world's population is exposed to dangerous levels of heat at least 20 days a year. Certain regions will be getting hit hard with this heat increase in the next ~30 years.[i][size=x-small][url=https://motherboard.vice.com/en_us/article/8x58e3/summer-heat-records-within-a-decade-shatter] >>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[b][color=white]To All Introverts: Leadership Is Enjoyable, Although Stressful[/color][/b]
This is quite an interesting read and would recommend you read the entire article along with the published study if you are interested. This study doesn't have solid evidence but it suggests that to an unknown degree, introverts are less likely to take on what's called a emergent leadership role. Psychologists define emergent leadership as a role of leadership without a formal hierarchy. A good example would be a group project. One person generally will take charge and become the leader and most of the time it is an extrovert. Back to the study, they suggested that introverts refrained from stepping up because they expected a negative outcome of emotion and feelings. Whether this study can be proved down the road or not, we can begin to adapt ahead of time.[i][size=x-small][url=https://digest.bps.org.uk/2017/10/06/introverts-may-miss-leadership-chances-because-they-overestimate-how-stressful-it-will-be/] >>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[b][color=white]Coffee In Moderation May Have Health Benefits[/color][/b]
If you're a coffee drinker like myself, then you may be happy to hear that coffee has health benefits for you. Though not proven, the study found some sort of link. This doesn't mean go and drink coffee for the health benefits such as lower risk of some cancers and liver disease. "There is a balance of risks in life, and the benefits of moderate consumption of coffee seem to outweigh the risks." For the pregnant ladies, you should probably avoid coffee due to the amount of caffeine in it can be a risk for a miscarriage. For the rest of the adults, the study defined moderate levels as 400mg of caffeine or less a day. Moderate levels are "healthy"-er than anything more than 400mg. Keep in mind this is measured by caffiene levels and coffee isn't the only food/drink with caffeine. Pike Place Coffee (grande) at Starbucks is 330mg of caffeine but the study says 400mg is about 3-4 cups of coffee so it does vary on what type of coffee and size. The authors also recommended drinking the healthy kinds of coffee: without [i]extra[/i] sugar, milk or cream. Personally, I'd avoid sugar, milk or cream entirely in coffee. I pickup a venti Pike Place daily, no sugar or cream. Keeps me wired up all day long. I've only covered a small portion of the study so I would recommend reading the study directly [url=http://www.bmj.com/content/359/bmj.j5024]here[/url] if you are interested.[i][size=x-small][url=http://www.bbc.com/news/health-42081278] >>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[align=center][url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=561239][img]https://i.imgur.com/0TCdM3i.png[/img][/url][/align]

[b][color=white]Hawaii, Belgium, and EU: Loot Boxes Is Gambling, Should Be Banned[/color][/b]
If you were vacationing in your cave the past few weeks, Battlefront 2 was the spotlight in gaming news all over the web. Not for a good reason though. Battlefront 2 had locked game content behind a loot box system and was estimated to take couple thousand hours of game time to get everything in the game for free. Doesn't stop there though. The game allowed you to purchase a type of token that expedited the process immensely but still was all based on luck. Now the concern with Hawaii and Belgium legislators is that some of these games are targetting children. Gambling is illegal under 21, 19, or 18 depending on location and they believe it's wrong to have a gambling-like loot box system in a game marketed to children. Need for Speed: Payback, Call of Duty: WWII, Battlefront 2, and Middle-Earth: Shadow of War are the most recent titles with a loot box system. The hope is that they either ban loot box systems from games meeting certain criteria or regulating them. They are currently investigating EA for its Battlefront 2 practices. For those wondering, loot boxes are legal because gambling is considered to be something you put money into but aren't guaranteed an item. In all these systems, you get either a duplicate, currency, or a new item. If you were to not receive anything in return, it would be illegal. Another legal point for gambling is that it's based on chance of pure luck and not skill. 
[b]Update:[/b] Belgium's investigation has completed and have found that loot boxes are indeed gambling. Belgium's gaming commission is pushing for EU wide regulation/ban.[i][size=x-small][url=https://www.polygon.com/2017/11/22/16690182/battlefront-2-loot-crates-hawaii-belgium-banned-regulation-investigate] >>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[b][color=white]Epic Games Sues 14-Yr Old For Cheating[/color][/b]
After Epic Games, creator of Fortnite, banned thousands of players and filed lawsuits against many of those cheaters, it turns out one of them is a 14-yr old boy. This is really interesting. Their lawsuit claims loss of profits but the game is free to play. They also are going after a 14-yr old child who used a hack instead of the websites who create and sell/share these hacks. I personally do not condone the use of hacks, but sueing a 14-yr old child is not right. The mother of the child has written a letter and sent it to the judge to have the lawsuit dismissed. In the letter, she brought up good points. She claims Epic Games is using her son as a scapegoat. She also states that Epic Games released the child's name publicaly which is illegal to release a minor's name publically without a release form. Fortnite's EULA was also incorrectly written so legally the game is considered free for underage players and their claim of "loss of profits" is invalid. Her final point was that Epic Games are requesting all the financial gain Caleb, her son, gained from live streaming Fortnite with hacks. He did not make a penny off live streaming, however, she stated. Good for this mother for standing up against Epic Games. Sueing a 14-yr old for using hacks is so flawed and can socially be considered immoral.[i][size=x-small][url=https://torrentfreak.com/images/epicreply1.pdf] >>Source[/url][/size][/i]
